title: Kafka Consumer Lag: Triage & Mitigation
contentMarkdown:
## When to use
- Consumer lag spikes or keeps increasing

## Quick checks
1. Check consumer group lag per partition
2. Look for hot partitions (one partition lagging much more)
3. Check processing time per message (p95/p99)
4. Verify retry/DLQ rates

## Common causes
- Downstream DB slow / connection pool exhausted
- Hot partition due to skewed keys
- Too few consumers or too low max.poll.records
- GC pauses / CPU throttling

## Mitigation
- Scale consumer replicas
- Add backpressure (pause/resume or rate limit)
- Increase partitions (long-term)
- Optimize DB writes / batching
- Enable DLQ for poison-pill messages

title: DB Connection Pool Exhaustion
contentMarkdown:
## Symptoms
- Increased request latency
- Errors like: timeout acquiring connection
- Threads waiting on pool

## Quick checks
1. Check active connections vs pool max
2. Check slow queries / locks
3. Verify transaction boundaries (@Transactional)
4. Check connection leaks

## Mitigation
- Increase pool size temporarily
- Reduce concurrency / apply rate limits
- Kill long-running queries (carefully)
- Add indexes / optimize slow queries
- Ensure connections are closed properly
